required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Assessment Of Follow-Up Methods For Patients Treated In The Long-Term With A Specific Aldosterone Receptor Antagonist

brief_summary.textblock:
On a population of patients followed by an office-based cardiologist and treated with eplerenone, the objectives of the survey are:
- To describe the characteristics of the population treated.
- To describe the methods of use of eplerenone (posology, duration of treatment, medicinal combinations).
- To describe the follow-up methods of the treatment.
- To describe the possible interruptions of the treatment

detailed_description.textblock: A sample size in the region of N = 400 patients will allow this accuracy of estimation, as for this size, the half-width would be equal to 5% for a frequency of 50% corresponding to a confidence interval of maximum width. In view of the type of survey and the need for 12 months of monitoring in the context of standard practice, it may be anticipated that the drop-off rate will be about 20%. A sample size of N = 500 patients was therefore chosen.

primary_outcome.measure: Systolic Ejection Fraction as a Measure of Left Ventricular Dysfunction at Inclusion for Full Analysis Set (FAS) Population
primary_outcome.description: Left ventricular dysfunction, a condition in which the left ventricle of the heart exhibits a decreased functionality, was assessed based on systolic ejection fraction. Systolic ejection fraction was the fraction of the end-diastolic volume (EDV) that was ejected out of left ventricle with each contraction.

primary_outcome.measure: Systolic Ejection Fraction as a Measure of Left Ventricular Dysfunction at Inclusion for Safety Analysis Set (SAS) Population
primary_outcome.description: Left ventricular dysfunction, a condition in which the left ventricle of the heart exhibits a decreased functionality, was assessed based on systolic ejection fraction. Systolic ejection fraction was the fraction of the end-diastolic volume (EDV) that was ejected out of left ventricle with each contraction.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Eplerenone Treatment Compliance at Month 3 in FAS Population
primary_outcome.description: Participants receiving eplerenone on the basis of the approved summary of product characteristics (SmPC) were said to be treatment compliant.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Eplerenone Treatment Compliance at Month 6 in FAS Population
primary_outcome.description: Participants receiving eplerenone on the basis of the approved SmPC were said to be treatment compliant.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Eplerenone Treatment Compliance at Month 9 in FAS Population
primary_outcome.description: Participants receiving eplerenone on the basis of the approved SmPC were said to be treatment compliant.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Eplerenone Treatment Compliance at Month 12 in FAS Population
primary_outcome.description: Participants receiving eplerenone on the basis of the approved SmPC were said to be treatment compliant.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Change From Baseline in Eplerenone Treatment Dosage at Month 3 in FAS Population
primary_outcome.description: Change of eplerenone dosage = modified dosage (mg daily) - dosage at start of treatment (mg daily). A positive change indicated dosage increase and a negative change indicated dosage decrease.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Change From Baseline in Eplerenone Treatment Dosage at Month 6 in FAS Population
primary_outcome.description: Change of eplerenone dosage = modified dosage (mg daily) - dosage at start of treatment (mg daily). A positive change indicated dosage increase and a negative change indicated dosage decrease.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Change From Baseline in Eplerenone Treatment Dosage at Month 9 in FAS Population
primary_outcome.description: Change of eplerenone dosage = modified dosage (mg daily) - dosage at start of treatment (mg daily). A positive change indicated dosage increase and a negative change indicated dosage decrease.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Change From Baseline in Eplerenone Treatment Dosage at Month 12 in FAS Population
primary_outcome.description: Change of eplerenone dosage = modified dosage (mg daily) - dosage at start of treatment (mg daily). A positive change indicated dosage increase and a negative change indicated dosage decrease.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Died in SAS Population
Percentage of Participants Hospitalized in FAS Population
Number of Participants With Worsened Renal Function

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Reason for Increased or Decreased Eplerenone Dose
Number of Participants With Concomitant Cardiovascular Treatment in FAS Population
secondary_outcome.description: Concomitant cardiovascular treatment included any cardiovascular treatment other than, and in addition to, the study treatment taken at any time during the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Concomitant Cardiovascular Treatment in SAS Population
secondary_outcome.description: Concomitant cardiovascular treatment included any cardiovascular treatment other than, and in addition to, the study treatment taken at any time during the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Discontinued Eplerenone Treatment in FAS Population

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Other Notable Events in FAS Population
other_outcome.description: Other notable events included any clinically significant event other than death or hospitalization (example, ventricular tachycardia treated by defibrillator, imbalanced diabetes, work accident, right foot gout crisis, low back pain-oliguria, chest pain, bronchitis, renal failure, heart failure, hypotension, edema, standardization of gamma glutamyl transpeptidase (GT) after stopping lamisyl (peros) prescribed for a long term for mycosis, pain, nausea, fracture, trauma, gonarthrosis, increased urea, elevation of gamma GT etc.).

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With General Practitioner (GP) Consultation in FAS Population
Number of Measurements Per Month for Kalaemia Levels in FAS Population
other_outcome.description: The presence of excess potassium in the circulating blood is called hyperkalaemia. Normal potassium serum level is 3.5 to- 5.0 millimole per liter (mmol/L). Number of measurements per month for the kalaemia levels was reported.

other_outcome.measure: Maximum Kalaemia Levels in Serum in FAS Population
other_outcome.description: The presence of excess potassium in the circulating blood is called hyperkalaemia. Normal potassium serum level is 3.5 to- 5.0 mmol/L.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Maximum Value of Kalaemia Levels in FAS Population
other_outcome.description: The presence of excess potassium in the circulating blood is called hyperkalaemia. Normal potassium serum level is 3.5 to- 5.0 mmol/L. Change in maximum value kalaemia level was calculated by subtracting the baseline values from the maximum observed value of kalaemia levels during the study.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Signs of Cardiac Insufficiency in FAS Population
other_outcome.description: New York Health Association (NYHA) functional classification included: Class I (no limitation in physical activity, no dyspnea with normal activity), Class II (slight limitation of physical activity; fatigue, palpitation, or dyspnea with ordinary physical activity), Class III (marked limitation of physical activity; fatigue, palpitation, or dyspnea with less than ordinary physical activity) and Class IV (cannot perform a physical activity without any symptoms, dyspnea at rest). Percentage of participants in each functional class was reported.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Reason for Starting Eplerenone Treatment in FAS Population
other_outcome.description: Reasons for starting eplerenone treatment included myocardial infarction, heart failure and other conditions including severe hypertension by primary hyperaldosteronism; hypertension/coronaropathy and hypokalaemia; hypertension; left ventricular failure; not tolerated spironolactone; hypertension: gynecomastia with aldactone; pulmonary suboedema; hypertension: adrenal hyperplasia, gynecomastia with aldactone; hypertension not controlled.

clinical_study.condition: Left Ventricular Dysfunction Post Myocardial Infarction

intervention.description: this is an observational study non interventional

study_pop.textblock:
The following patients may be selected to participate in the survey:
- Those undergoing treatment with eplerenone in accordance with the MA or not, with a known start date.
- Those likely to be followed by the same physician for a minimal period of twelve months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
The following patients may be selected to participate in the survey:
- Those undergoing treatment with eplerenone in accordance with the MA or not, with a known start date.
- Those likely to be followed by the same physician for a minimal period of twelve months.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe Kidney Disease
- Hyperkamiemia more than 5.5

clinical_study.keyword: patients with MI- on top of treatment add Eplerenone - assess LVEF and BP

group.title: Eplerenone
group.description: Participants who received eplerenone according to the approved summary of product characteristics (SmPC) were observed for 12 months. Eplerenone treatment initiated at 25 mg once daily and titrated to the target dose of 50 mg once daily within 4 weeks based on the kalaemia level.

group.description: Participants who received eplerenone according to the approved summary of product characteristics (SmPC) were observed for 12 months. Eplerenone treatment initiated at 25 mg once daily and titrated to the target dose of 50 mg once daily within 4 weeks based on the kalaemia level.

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Out of a total of 160 participants, data for baseline measure (age) was available for only 159 participants.

measure.title: Gender

outcome.title: Systolic Ejection Fraction as a Measure of Left Ventricular Dysfunction at Inclusion for Full Analysis Set (FAS) Population
outcome.description: Left ventricular dysfunction, a condition in which the left ventricle of the heart exhibits a decreased functionality, was assessed based on systolic ejection fraction. Systolic ejection fraction was the fraction of the end-diastolic volume (EDV) that was ejected out of left ventricle with each contraction.
outcome.population: FAS population included all participants who had been on study medication with inclusion questionnaire and at least one follow-up questionnaire completed, and excluded those participants with treatment start date occurring after the inclusion date. 'N' (number of participants analyzed)= participants evaluable for this measure.

outcome.title: Maximum Kalaemia Levels in Serum in FAS Population
outcome.description: The presence of excess potassium in the circulating blood is called hyperkalaemia. Normal potassium serum level is 3.5 to- 5.0 mmol/L.
outcome.population: FAS population included all participants who had been on study medication with inclusion questionnaire and at least one follow-up questionnaire completed, and excluded those participants with treatment start date occurring after the inclusion date. 'N' (number of participants analyzed)= participants evaluable for this measure.

group.title: Eplerenone
group.description: Participants who received eplerenone according to the approved summary of product characteristics (SmPC) were observed for 12 months. Eplerenone treatment initiated at 25 mg once daily and titrated to the target dose of 50 mg once daily within 4 weeks based on the kalaemia level.

measure.title: Maximum Kalaemia Levels in Serum in FAS Population
measure.description: The presence of excess potassium in the circulating blood is called hyperkalaemia. Normal potassium serum level is 3.5 to- 5.0 mmol/L.
measure.population: FAS population included all participants who had been on study medication with inclusion questionnaire and at least one follow-up questionnaire completed, and excluded those participants with treatment start date occurring after the inclusion date. 'N' (number of participants analyzed)= participants evaluable for this measure.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Maximum Value of Kalaemia Levels in FAS Population
outcome.description: The presence of excess potassium in the circulating blood is called hyperkalaemia. Normal potassium serum level is 3.5 to- 5.0 mmol/L. Change in maximum value kalaemia level was calculated by subtracting the baseline values from the maximum observed value of kalaemia levels during the study.
outcome.population: FAS population. 'N' (number of participants analyzed)= participants evaluable for this measure. Here 'n' is signifying those participants who were evaluable for this measure at given time point for each group respectively.

group.title: Eplerenone
group.description: Participants who received eplerenone according to the approved summary of product characteristics (SmPC) were observed for 12 months. Eplerenone treatment initiated at 25 mg once daily and titrated to the target dose of 50 mg once daily within 4 weeks based on the kalaemia level.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Maximum Value of Kalaemia Levels in FAS Population
measure.description: The presence of excess potassium in the circulating blood is called hyperkalaemia. Normal potassium serum level is 3.5 to- 5.0 mmol/L. Change in maximum value kalaemia level was calculated by subtracting the baseline values from the maximum observed value of kalaemia levels during the study.
measure.population: FAS population. 'N' (number of participants analyzed)= participants evaluable for this measure. Here 'n' is signifying those participants who were evaluable for this measure at given time point for each group respectively.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Signs of Cardiac Insufficiency in FAS Population
outcome.description: New York Health Association (NYHA) functional classification included: Class I (no limitation in physical activity, no dyspnea with normal activity), Class II (slight limitation of physical activity; fatigue, palpitation, or dyspnea with ordinary physical activity), Class III (marked limitation of physical activity; fatigue, palpitation, or dyspnea with less than ordinary physical activity) and Class IV (cannot perform a physical activity without any symptoms, dyspnea at rest). Percentage of participants in each functional class was reported.
outcome.population: FAS population. Here 'n' is signifying those participants who were evaluable for this measure at given time point for each group respectively.

group.title: Eplerenone
group.description: Participants who received eplerenone according to the approved summary of product characteristics (SmPC) were observed for 12 months. Eplerenone treatment initiated at 25 mg once daily and titrated to the target dose of 50 mg once daily within 4 weeks based on the kalaemia level.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Signs of Cardiac Insufficiency in FAS Population
measure.description: New York Health Association (NYHA) functional classification included: Class I (no limitation in physical activity, no dyspnea with normal activity), Class II (slight limitation of physical activity; fatigue, palpitation, or dyspnea with ordinary physical activity), Class III (marked limitation of physical activity; fatigue, palpitation, or dyspnea with less than ordinary physical activity) and Class IV (cannot perform a physical activity without any symptoms, dyspnea at rest). Percentage of participants in each functional class was reported.
measure.population: FAS population. Here 'n' is signifying those participants who were evaluable for this measure at given time point for each group respectively.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Reason for Starting Eplerenone Treatment in FAS Population
outcome.description: Reasons for starting eplerenone treatment included myocardial infarction, heart failure and other conditions including severe hypertension by primary hyperaldosteronism; hypertension/coronaropathy and hypokalaemia; hypertension; left ventricular failure; not tolerated spironolactone; hypertension: gynecomastia with aldactone; pulmonary suboedema; hypertension: adrenal hyperplasia, gynecomastia with aldactone; hypertension not controlled.
outcome.population: FAS population. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) is signifying those participants who were evaluable for this measure.

group.title: Eplerenone
group.description: Participants who received eplerenone according to the approved summary of product characteristics (SmPC) were observed for 12 months. Eplerenone treatment initiated at 25 mg once daily and titrated to the target dose of 50 mg once daily within 4 weeks based on the kalaemia level.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Eplerenone
group.description: Participants who received eplerenone according to the approved summary of product characteristics (SmPC) were observed for 12 months. Eplerenone treatment initiated at 25 mg once daily and titrated to the target dose of 50 mg once daily within 4 weeks based on the kalaemia level.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
